required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Avera McKennan Hospital & University Health Center

clinical_study.source: Avera McKennan Hospital & University Health Center

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to identify drivers of cancer by performing comprehensive genetic, proteomic, and metabolomic characterization of patient samples as a basis for understanding the underlying cause of disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This study involves looking at the DNA, RNA, proteins, and metabolites in blood and tissue samples collected from subjects and linking them to their health information. By doing so, researchers hope to discover the underlying molecular causes of human diseases with the hope that this information can be used for the development of diagnostic tests and more effective treatments.

primary_outcome.description: To determine genetic changes associated with the development and growth of human disease. This should lead to better ways to detect, prevent, and treat a wide variety of human health conditions, including cancer.

arm_group.description: Molecular profiled group receiving treatment based on genetics

intervention.description: Patients and their treating physician will obtain the patient's genetic risk assessment

biospec_descr.textblock:
Participants will have up to 3 blood tubes (about 30 ml) drawn under the condition that protocol criteria for blood sampling is met. Blood samples may be collected each time a participant undergoes a provider-ordered blood draw. Urine samples may also be collected approximately every 4-6 weeks.
Participants may be asked to provide approximately 60-120 ml of first-morning-void urine. Tissue from a standard care surgical procedure or biopsy may be obtained. Additional core biopsies (for research) or excess surgical waste will be collected during each biopsy procedure when appropriate and will be processed and stored.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have been diagnosed with cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnoses with cancer but healthy enough to undergo a biopsy procedure
- Between the ages of 18 and 100
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant

overall_official.affiliation: Avera McKennan Hospital & University Health Center
